page.title: 02GEOLOGY AND LANDSCAPE
page.content:
One of the most significant features of the landscape of the area is the terracing of the hills due to what has become known as "The Yoredale Series". This is the name given to a series of rock strata layered in a regular pattern - sandstone, shale, limestone - the irregular erosion of which has formed steps down which flow many waterfalls. The Dale was formed by the action of glaciers moving to the east. The drumlins left by this action are another major feature and the Roman Camp (Virosidum), east of Bainbridge was established on a large drumlin.
The major human feature of the landscape is the network of dry-stone walls and the buildings, both constructed utilising local limestone and sandstone.
